list_definition.definition: to take in or consider along with (other people, things etc) as part of a group, set etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Am I included in the team?
Your duties include making the tea.

list_ex_of_english: Attempts were made to include as many residents as possible.
Note that we have not included examples with a past tense form (cf. section 3.4.1) in the discussion.
Other bank financing is included in 'other' sources.
The arrest records included the date and type of each offense.
In this design, the matched co- included in the sample.
Because-type connectives include due to (the fact that), for the reason that, and in view of (the fact that).
We felt this was about the maximum number of structural members that should be included in the canopy, 129 members.
In addition, 19 nonclinical children between the ages of 8 and 12 years were included as part of a larger community sample.
